name: tckglobal
description:
Multi-Shell Multi-Tissue Global Tractography.

This command will reconstruct the global white matter fibre tractogram that best explains the input DWI data, using a multi-tissue spherical convolution model.

Example use: 

 $ tckglobal dwi.mif wmr.txt -riso csfr.txt -riso gmr.txt -mask mask.mif 
   -niter 1e9 -fod fod.mif -fiso fiso.mif tracks.tck 

in which dwi.mif is the input image, wmr.txt is an anisotropic, multi-shell response function for WM, and csfr.txt and gmr.txt are isotropic response functions for CSF and GM. The output tractogram is saved to tracks.tck. Optional output images fod.mif and fiso.mif contain the predicted WM fODF and isotropic tissue fractions of CSF and GM respectively, estimated as part of the global optimization and thus affected by spatial regularization.

References:

Christiaens, D.; Reisert, M.; Dhollander, T.; Sunaert, S.; Suetens, P. & Maes, F. Global tractography of multi-shell diffusion-weighted imaging data using a multi-tissue model. NeuroImage, 2015, 123, 89-101
author: Daan Christiaens (daan.christiaens@kcl.ac.uk)

inputs.name: source
inputs.description: the image containing the raw DWI data.

inputs.name: response
inputs.description: the response of a track segment on the DWI signal.

inputs.name: tracks
inputs.description: the output file containing the tracks generated.

inputs.name: grad
inputs.description: specify the diffusion encoding scheme (required if not supplied in the header).

inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: only reconstruct the tractogram within the specified brain mask image.

inputs.name: riso
inputs.description: set one or more isotropic response functions. (multiple allowed)

type.name: riso
type.description: set one or more isotropic response functions. (multiple allowed)

inputs.name: response
inputs.description: set one or more isotropic response functions. (multiple allowed)

inputs.name: lmax
inputs.description: set the maximum harmonic order for the output series. (default = 8)

inputs.name: length
inputs.description: set the length of the particles (fibre segments). (default = 1mm)

inputs.name: weight
inputs.description: set the weight by which particles contribute to the model. (default = 0.1)

inputs.name: ppot
inputs.description: set the particle potential, i.e., the cost of adding one segment, relative to the particle weight. (default = 0.05)

inputs.name: cpot
inputs.description: set the connection potential, i.e., the energy term that drives two segments together. (default = 0.5)

inputs.name: t0
inputs.description: set the initial temperature of the metropolis hastings optimizer. (default = 0.1)

inputs.name: t1
inputs.description: set the final temperature of the metropolis hastings optimizer. (default = 0.001)

inputs.name: niter
inputs.description: set the number of iterations of the metropolis hastings optimizer. (default = 10M)

inputs.name: fod
inputs.description:
Predicted fibre orientation distribution function (fODF).
This fODF is estimated as part of the global track optimization, and therefore incorporates the spatial regularization that it imposes. Internally, the fODF is represented as a discrete sum of apodized point spread functions (aPSF) oriented along the directions of all particles in the voxel, used to predict the DWI signal from the particle configuration.

inputs.name: noapo
inputs.description: disable spherical convolution of fODF with apodized PSF, to output a sum of delta functions rather than a sum of aPSFs.

inputs.name: fiso
inputs.description: Predicted isotropic fractions of the tissues for which response functions were provided with -riso. Typically, these are CSF and GM.

inputs.name: eext
inputs.description: Residual external energy in every voxel.

inputs.name: etrend
inputs.description: internal and external energy trend and cooling statistics.

inputs.name: balance
inputs.description:
balance internal and external energy. (default = 0)
Negative values give more weight to the internal energy, positive to the external energy.

inputs.name: density
inputs.description: set the desired density of the free Poisson process. (default = 1)

inputs.name: prob
inputs.description: set the probabilities of generating birth, death, randshift, optshift and connect proposals respectively. (default = 0.25,0.05,0.25,0.1,0.35)

inputs.name: beta
inputs.description:
set the width of the Hanning interpolation window. (in [0, 1], default = 0)
If used, a mask is required, and this mask must keep at least one voxel distance to the image bounding box.

inputs.name: lambda
inputs.description:
set the weight of the internal energy directly. (default = 1)
If provided, any value of -balance will be ignored.

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.

output-files.name: tracks
output-files.description: the output file containing the tracks generated.

output-files.name: fod
output-files.description:
Predicted fibre orientation distribution function (fODF).
This fODF is estimated as part of the global track optimization, and therefore incorporates the spatial regularization that it imposes. Internally, the fODF is represented as a discrete sum of apodized point spread functions (aPSF) oriented along the directions of all particles in the voxel, used to predict the DWI signal from the particle configuration.

output-files.name: fiso
output-files.description: Predicted isotropic fractions of the tissues for which response functions were provided with -riso. Typically, these are CSF and GM.

output-files.name: eext
output-files.description: Residual external energy in every voxel.

output-files.name: etrend
output-files.description: internal and external energy trend and cooling statistics.
